statements.statement: Parents find child-care to be the most meaningful activity.
Parents find work-related activities the least rewarding with regard to child care.
In the 2010 Pew Research Center study, parents found child care more meaningful than all other activities included for comparison.
26% fewer parents rated "Paid work" as being more meaningful than "Child-care."
Surveyed parents ranked childcare a "very meaningful" activity at a higher rate than they did any other habitual activity.
The single most important trend of this visualization is that child care is more meaningful than time spent working for money.
This graph shows that indeed the ideal of child care is a great idea when compared to other activites.
parents who find  housework and paid work meaning full are more than child care and  parents who find leisure as meaning full are almost same % as child-care
The most precious things in life are what we find the most meaningful.
PARENTS FOUND CHILD CARE TO BE ALARGEPART OF TODAYS SOCIATY
I BELIEVE PEOPLE TODAY MOST FEEL THEY CAN SEE HOW THEY WILL LIVE THEIR LIFE
PARENTS KNOW THEY WILL BE WORKING AND THEY WILL HAVE CHILD CARE
CHILDREN WILL TURN OUT TO BE MUCH BETTER ADULTS WITH THE PROPER CHILD CARE
IF WE HAVE GOOD ADULTS FROM PROPER SUPERVISION WORLD IS MUCH BETTER FOR IT
Parents ranked child-care as the most meaningful activity.
62% of adults with children under 18 in their household rate child care as being very meaninful.
The trend shows that child-care is the most rewarding experience compared to leisure, housework and paid work.
It's interesting that the most people see child-care as most meaningful, while work is the least meaningful.
Regarding the activities listed here as "very meaningful," child-care was considered most meaningful by those polled, followed by leisure, housework, and paid work.
People with children value family over money.

nuggets.nugget: Nearly 2/3 of parents find child-care activities very meaningful.
Roughly 60% of parents find leisure activities very meaningful.
Roughly 40% of parents find housework activities very meaningful.
Only 1/3 of parents find paid work activities very meaningful.
Child-care activities are deemed most meaningful by parents among the activities listed.
Paid work activities are deemed least meaningful by parents among the activities listed.
